item.title: Mounting an NTFS disk on macOS
item.description: Unfortunately NTFS is not natively supported on macOS, but sometimes we need write access to an NTFS disk. EDIT: Now you can install the official osxfuse without any problem. brew tap gromgit/homebrew-fuse brew reinstall macfuse brew install ntfs-3g-mac And securely mount your USB drive in a read-write access: sudo /usr/local/bin/ntfs-3g /dev/disk3s1 /Volumes/NTFS -olocal -oallow_other -o auto_xattr The first time you try to mount it, you will be asked to give macOS permissions for osxfuse and a request for reboot.
